posts.title: Newark mayor arrested by ICE agents at detention center
top_comments:
"Witnesses said the arrest came after Baraka attempted to join a scheduled tour of the facility with three members of New Jersey’s congressional delegation, Reps. Robert Menendez, LaMonica McIver, and Bonnie Watson Coleman.

When federal officials blocked his entry, a heated argument broke out, according to Viri Martinez, an activist with the New Jersey Alliance for Immigrant Justice. It continued even after Baraka returned to the public side of the gates.

. . . 

In video of the altercation shared with The Associated Press, a federal official in a jacket with the logo of the Homeland Security Investigations can be heard telling Baraka he could not join a tour of the facility because “you are not a congress member.”

Baraka then left the secure area, rejoining protesters on the public side of the gate. Video showed him speaking through the gate to a man in a suit, who informed him: “They’re talking about coming back to arrest you.”

“I’m not on their property, they can’t come out on the street and arrest me,” Baraka replied.

Minutes later several ICE agents, some wearing face coverings, surrounded Baraka and others on the public side of the gate. As protesters cried out, “Shame,” Baraka was dragged back through the security gate in handcuffs."
Wow surprising, they are all masked.

Alina Habba is a fucking US ATTORNEY?

I guess I shouldn’t be surprised…
What a fucking joke

Democrats need to aggressively oppose this gestapo shit AND offer a lawful and humane immigration solution
Something’s going to give in this country. All this is already happening and Trump has only been in power 100 days and some change. Can’t even imagine how much worse things are going to get.
Gestapo doin Gestapo shit.

It is not mistake. It is blatant racism. 

"An ICE attorney in Dallas, James “Jim” Joseph Rodden, is under scrutiny following allegations that he operated a white supremacist account on X (formerly Twitter) under the handle u/GlomarResponder".

[https://www.texasobserver.org/ice-prosecutor-dallas-white-supremacist-x-account/](https://www.texasobserver.org/ice-prosecutor-dallas-white-supremacist-x-account/)
ICE is a rogue paramilitary unit. Fuck ICE
What I don't understand is how ICE was able to arrest him. If this is criminal trespass, and it is committed by a citizen, then local police had jurisdiction.
Arresting judges and elected officials. Don't overreact. Totally normal....in places like Nazi Germany.
This administration is disgusting

posts.title: FedEx board member Steiner is picked to be next USPS postmaster general amid talk of privatization
top_comments: Ahh, I remember the good old days when admins at least pretended to care about 'conflict of interest'.
Almost every business in the US relies on USPS this would be an unmitigated disaster. Trumps rural base would also get screwed which would be a silver lining.

USPS is constitutionally mandated. We would need a constitutional amendment to privatize it.

First Class mail will be $5, though. And It won't go to every address in the U.S. in a short amount of time.
In a few years a Democratic president will say it's not possible to get rid of this person.
Let’s pick someone from the shittiest, most unreliable courier service in America to be the next postmaster. That makes sense.
They are going to privatize it. Once Dejoy was in it was just a matter of time.

#SAVE the USPS

USPS is one of America’s oldest institutions. Benjamin Franklin was the first Postmaster.
Every Trump agency head pick is an intentional act to destroy the agency they're heading.
FedEx is the absolute worst of the shipping companies. Really bottom of the barrel in every way.

Between this, selling off national parks, shutting down other public institutions for private gain... We're going to look like the oligarchy in Russia after the fall of the USSR.

It's going to take decades to repair, if we even can fix it at all.

posts.title: US grants asylum to 54 white Afrikaner South Africans, reports say
top_comments:
>On Thursday, US officials were trying to arrange a charter flight to land at Dulles international airport, with commercial flights being assessed as an alternative, NPR reported, citing unnamed sources.

>The Department of Health and Human Services will help the South Africans with “housing … basic home furnishings, essential household items … groceries, weather-appropriate clothing, diapers, formula, hygiene products and prepaid phones,” according to a memo seen by the New York Times.

I just don't know where to begin. They may, in fact, face discrimination. Maybe even violence. And that's terrible. But rolling out the red carpet for these people while Donald Trump, all by himself, cancelled 100,000 asylum claims is beyond the pale.

I thought they hated giving free handouts to migrants. If what the NY Times found is true then what's all this:

>The Department of Health and Human Services will help the South Africans with “housing … basic home furnishings, essential household items … groceries, weather-appropriate clothing, diapers, formula, hygiene products and prepaid phones,” according to a memo seen by the New York Times.

The fucking hypocrisy.
💯  Elon Musk and Peter Thiel,  fucking nazis
I didn't think we needed more obvious evidence that this country has been hijacked by white supremacists but here we are.

Meanwhile We abandoned Afghans, many of whom assisted the US military, who are literally IN HIDING?

https://apnews.com/article/afghanistan-refugees-qatar-trump-immigration-refugee-ban-006240c5700fa7a95e4c2f2dcf66ad4f


Question- How many Afrikaner/White South Africans immigrate to the US per year normally? 

This reminds me of the case of the German family who applied for US asylum because they homeschooled and that is/was illegal in Germany.

BTW- It usually takes years of waiting and vetting to be granted asylum. This. is. a. joke.

It was never about legal versus illegal immigration.

It has always been about racism.

So let me get this straight, when it's POC looking for asylum in America its bad. But when it's white people, its good? And not to mention all the free shit their getting as well? Hypocrisy of the highest order.

This administration is a joke. These white people were handed asylum and are getting "government handouts" like housing. Yet POC who lived in "shithole" countries who were already in the process of being granted citizenship are sent to a concentration camp in El Salvador. Pathetic

Literally can’t make this shit up 💀

-asylum seekers from Mexico: NOO 😡 NOT CITIZENSS😠🤬GET OUT😤

-white asylum seekers from South Africa: oh no! 😥 my sweet poor babies 😩 let me welcome you with open arms 🤗

grants asylum, gives them a fat stack of cash, subsidizes their rent, provides them free college/vocational training....

your tax dollars at work.... for elon

posts.title: The U.S. has 1,001 measles cases and 11 states with active outbreaks
top_comments: One thousand cases. In 2025. This should not be happening.

Number of cases in US by Year:  
2020 = 13  
2021 = 49  
2022 = 121  
2023 = 59  
2024 = 285  
2025 as of Today = 1,001

Hmm... One of these things aren't like the others.
Make measles great again! Well done you bunch of friggin clowns.
Texas should be sued for this
Man, if only we could find a way to prevent this from happening…
If only science had come up with a way to protect people and limit the spread of diseases.

You know if there are 1000 cases the number is 10x or 100x that. 

I know 5 people myself who had Measels but weren’t reported to the state.
Natural suppression of republican voters.
I’d put money on it being underreported.
More active measles cases than trans people playing sports.

posts.title: Radar screens at Newark airport went black again overnight
top_comments: at this point, I'm waiting to wake up to the headline of a massive tragedy happening at the airport. seems like things are getting dire if there is pressure getting pushed to get this fixed; as it should be. I hope someone get's their head out of their ass and gets this prioritized a week ago.
Statistics say its probably ok, but I still just changed my upcoming flight so I don't have to connect through Newark.

> Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said he hopes to have the system built in the next three to four years.
  
That's the timeframe for fixing this problem?

Huh, I remember the last president wanting to spend billions on reinvesting on FAA infrastructure. It even got bipartisan support... Odd they can't just use the money that is already promised to help with this
Republicans have blocked funding for this for 20 years.
I'm flying out of Newark twice in the next two weeks. Can't wait to roll the dice with my life lol.

The Daily had a good episode on this a few days ago. Boils down to latency and lack of backup when their systems do go down and how easy it is for someone to just unplug these systems with no oversight. These systems are also old and need to be upgraded. Newark ATC employees were based in Long Island but FAA moved them to Philadelphia but kept the transmissions still going through Long Island and relaying to Philadelphia

Time to blame the previous administration for requesting **more** staff and modernization updates to prevent this happening.  Clearly that's the issue, not firing air traffic controllers and staff that keeps things running.
Just a preview of the problems we can expect when you take a wrecking ball to government with minimal to no planning. Who cares about infrastructure when you can have tax cuts.

Natural result of deferring upkeep of infrastructure maintenance in the chase of budget cuts.  Expect more of this as long as the conservative/libertarian ideology is making decisions.

Fifty years of the destructive meme that government needs to get out of the way of free enterprise.  You trust that your planes will fly, food & drugs will be safe, etc because of the regulatory state.

posts.title: Cargo thieves are attacking the U.S. supply chain at alarming rates
top_comments:
Every day we inch closer to the cyberpunk universe... which sounds cool except that genre is a screaming thrashing industrial noised warning about a dystopian nightmare ruled by outrageously wealthy psychopaths.

.. but at least we should get some good music out of it.

With the tariff taxes will come smuggling and the increase of organized crime. Border patrol agents will get rich looking the other way as trucks roll across the boarders in remote locations.  However Trump will figure out how to get his cut as well.
We’re going Mad Max way quicker than I thought.
Did anyone check with Dom Toretto and his crew? They might be trying to steal VCRs, DVD players and camcorders again.
with the direction tariffs are sending these prices, it will soon be the only way to get anything.
When poverty increases, so does crime. Mass firings in the government. Huge layoffs in the private sector as businesses brace for the impacts of tariffs.
With much of the law enforcement emphasis on immigrants and frankly targeting just regular people, I feel like these types of crimes are only going to increase.

I recall there being a huge uptick in stories like this the last time the supply chain got fucked up during the peak of the pandemic. Seems like cargo thieves are a force that should be planned for in economic models. Like maybe anytime there's a spike in either prices or how much inventory is sitting in the port, cargo thieves jump in.
Didn’t know it was a Comley truck.
Hahahahahahahahahahaha they created a black market for normal shit. This timeline is so ridiculous 🤣

posts.title: Two men found guilty of cutting down famous Sycamore Gap tree.
top_comments: I live on the other side of the planet and this really piss me off. I always wanted to go see Hadrians wall and this a stop I’ll make.
Wanton destruction for destructions' sake. They cut a tree down *because* it was iconic, no other reason. Just to break a thing that people enjoyed. Purely selfish.

After reading the online reactions the two men were sending each other texts saying their critics "didnt have the minerals" to do what they did. They cut down a tree in the middle of nowhere at night and these pair of cunts think they pulled off a heist in a Guy Ritchie movie.
What absolute morons, ruining their lives for no reason at all. Enjoy the loss of your business, income, and any reputation you may have had. Plus possibly prison. Idiots.

Drove thirty miles through a storm just to make the world a little uglier.

You fuckers, my faith in humanity is already on fumes
They deserve to go to jail for this.

Daniel Graham, 39, and Adam Carruthers, 32

Fucking useless pieces of shit. It’s not even like it was a few dumb teens. Throw away the key, these people are fucked
Grown men doing something like that,, pathetic. They should have to pay for their destruction for the rest of their lives.
I saw the tree three weeks before it was cut down. Glad I got to see it before this happened. Waited my whole life to see it.

>Carruthers, a mechanic living in a caravan in Kirkbride, said he was not at the site of the crime. His barrister, Andrew Gurney, said it made no sense for a man to be “gallivanting around the national park cutting down Sycamore Gap” just five days after his partner had left hospital with their newborn baby.

Correct. It, in fact, does not *make sense* for this guy with two rocks rattling around in his skull to be out doing this crime leaving his partner home with a newborn.

However, it "not making sense" doesn't show that he was innocent, but the true shit-tier value of his character.

posts.title: Newark mayor arrested by ICE agents at detention center
top_comments:
"Witnesses said the arrest came after Baraka attempted to join a scheduled tour of the facility with three members of New Jersey’s congressional delegation, Reps. Robert Menendez, LaMonica McIver, and Bonnie Watson Coleman.

When federal officials blocked his entry, a heated argument broke out, according to Viri Martinez, an activist with the New Jersey Alliance for Immigrant Justice. It continued even after Baraka returned to the public side of the gates.

. . . 

In video of the altercation shared with The Associated Press, a federal official in a jacket with the logo of the Homeland Security Investigations can be heard telling Baraka he could not join a tour of the facility because “you are not a congress member.”

Baraka then left the secure area, rejoining protesters on the public side of the gate. Video showed him speaking through the gate to a man in a suit, who informed him: “They’re talking about coming back to arrest you.”

“I’m not on their property, they can’t come out on the street and arrest me,” Baraka replied.

Minutes later several ICE agents, some wearing face coverings, surrounded Baraka and others on the public side of the gate. As protesters cried out, “Shame,” Baraka was dragged back through the security gate in handcuffs."
Wow surprising, they are all masked.
